message_1:
Let X be a topological space with the topology T = {∅, {a}, {b}, {a, b}}. Determine whether the following statements are true or false:

1. {a} is an open set in X.
2. {b} is a closed set in X.
3. {a,b} is a closed set in X.
4. {a,b} is an open set in X.
message_2:
1. {a} is an open set in X.
True. Since {a} is an element of the topology T, it is considered an open set in X.

2. {b} is a closed set in X.
True. A set is closed if its complement is open. The complement of {b} is {a}, which is an open set in X. Therefore, {b} is a closed set.

3. {a,b} is a closed set in X.
True. A set is closed if its complement is open. The complement of {a, b} is the empty set ∅, which is an open set in X. Therefore, {a, b} is a closed set.

4. {a,b} is an open set in X.
True. Since {a, b} is an element of the topology T, it is considered an open set in X.
